Home > external > getDiamond.m

getDiamond

PURPOSE

getDiamond

SYNOPSIS

function blastStructure=getDiamond(organismID,fastaFile,modelIDs,refFastaFiles)

DESCRIPTION 

 getDiamond
   Uses DIAMOND to performs a bidirectional BLASTP between the organism
   of interest and a set of template organisms.

   Input:
   organismID      the id of the organism of interest. This should also
                   match with the id supplied to getModelFromHomology
   fastaFile       a FASTA file with the protein sequences for the
                   organism of interest
   modelIDs        a cell array of model ids. These must match the
                   "model.id" fields in the "models" structure if the
                   output is to be used with getModelFromHomology
   refFastaFiles   a cell array with the paths to the corresponding FASTA
                   files

   Output:
   blastStructure  structure containing the bidirectional homology
                   measurements which are used by getModelFromHomology

   NOTE: This function calls DIAMOND to perform a bidirectional homology
   test between the organism of interest and a set of other organisms
   using the '--more-sensitive' setting from DIAMOND. For the most
   sensitive results, the use of getBlast() is adviced, however,
   getDiamond() is a fast alternative (>15x faster). The blastStructure
   generated is in the same format as those obtained from getBlast().

   Usage: blastStructure=getDiamond(organismID,fastaFile,modelIDs,...
           refFastaFiles)

   Simonas Marcisauskas, 2019-08-17

CROSS-REFERENCE INFORMATION

This function calls:
This function is called by:

0001 function blastStructure=getDiamond(organismID,fastaFile,modelIDs,refFastaFiles)
0002 % getDiamond
0003 %   Uses DIAMOND to performs a bidirectional BLASTP between the organism
0004 %   of interest and a set of template organisms.
0005 %
0006 %   Input:
0007 %   organismID      the id of the organism of interest. This should also
0008 %                   match with the id supplied to getModelFromHomology
0009 %   fastaFile       a FASTA file with the protein sequences for the
0010 %                   organism of interest
0011 %   modelIDs        a cell array of model ids. These must match the
0012 %                   "model.id" fields in the "models" structure if the
0013 %                   output is to be used with getModelFromHomology
0014 %   refFastaFiles   a cell array with the paths to the corresponding FASTA
0015 %                   files
0016 %
0017 %   Output:
0018 %   blastStructure  structure containing the bidirectional homology
0019 %                   measurements which are used by getModelFromHomology
0020 %
0021 %   NOTE: This function calls DIAMOND to perform a bidirectional homology
0022 %   test between the organism of interest and a set of other organisms
0023 %   using the '--more-sensitive' setting from DIAMOND. For the most
0024 %   sensitive results, the use of getBlast() is adviced, however,
0025 %   getDiamond() is a fast alternative (>15x faster). The blastStructure
0026 %   generated is in the same format as those obtained from getBlast().
0027 %
0028 %   Usage: blastStructure=getDiamond(organismID,fastaFile,modelIDs,...
0029 %           refFastaFiles)
0030 %
0031 %   Simonas Marcisauskas, 2019-08-17
0032 %
0033 
0034 %Everything should be cell arrays
0035 organismID=cellstr(organismID);
0036 fastaFile=cellstr(fastaFile);
0037 modelIDs=cellstr(modelIDs);
0038 refFastaFiles=cellstr(refFastaFiles);
0039 
0040 blastStructure=[];
0041 
0042 %Get the directory for RAVEN Toolbox. This may not be the easiest or best
0043 %way to do this
0044 [ST, I]=dbstack('-completenames');
0045 ravenPath=fileparts(fileparts(ST(I).file));
0046 
0047 %Construct databases and output file
0048 tmpDB=tempname;
0049 outFile=tempname;
0050 
0051 %Check for existence of files. If no full path is specified for a file,
0052 %assume that it is in the current folder
0053 if isrow(refFastaFiles)
0054     files=horzcat(fastaFile,refFastaFiles);
0055 else
0056     files=vertcat(fastaFile,refFastaFiles);
0057 end
0058 
0059 files=checkFileExistence(files,true,false); %No whitespace allowed
0060 fastaFile = files(1);
0061 refFastaFiles = files(2:end);
0062 
0063 %Create a database for the new organism and blast each of the refFastaFiles
0064 %against it
0065 
0066 if isunix
0067     if ismac
0068         binEnd='.mac';
0069     else
0070         binEnd='';
0071     end
0072 elseif ispc
0073     binEnd='';
0074 else
0075     dispEM('Unknown OS, exiting.')
0076     return
0077 end
0078 
0079 % Run BLAST multi-threaded to use all logical cores assigned to MATLAB.
0080 cores = evalc('feature(''numcores'')');
0081 cores = strsplit(cores, 'MATLAB was assigned: ');
0082 cores = regexp(cores{2},'^\d*','match');
0083 cores = cores{1};
0084 
0085 [status, ~]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','diamond',['diamond' binEnd]) '" makedb --in "' fastaFile{1} '" --db "' tmpDB '"']);
0086 if status~=0
0087     EM=['DIAMOND makedb did not run successfully, error: ', num2str(status)];
0088     dispEM(EM,true);
0089 end
0090 
0091 for i=1:numel(refFastaFiles)
0092     fprintf(['Running DIAMOND blastp with "' modelIDs{i} '" against "' organismID{1} '"..\n']);
0093     [status, ~]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','diamond',['diamond' binEnd]) '" blastp --query "' refFastaFiles{i} '" --out "' outFile '_' num2str(i) '" --db "' tmpDB '" --more-sensitive --outfmt 6 qseqid sseqid evalue pident length bitscore ppos --threads ' cores ]);
0094     if status~=0
0095         EM=['DIAMOND blastp did not run successfully, error: ', num2str(status)];
0096         dispEM(EM,true);
0097     end
0098 end
0099 delete([tmpDB '*']);
0100 
0101 %Then create a database for each of the reference organisms and blast the
0102 %new organism against them
0103 for i=1:numel(refFastaFiles)
0104     fprintf(['Running DIAMOND blastp with "' organismID{1} '" against "' modelIDs{i} '"..\n']);
0105     [status, ~]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','diamond',['diamond' binEnd]) '" makedb --in "' refFastaFiles{i} '" --db "' tmpDB '"']);
0106     if status~=0
0107         EM=['DIAMOND makedb did not run successfully, error: ', num2str(status)];
0108         dispEM(EM,true);
0109     end
0110     [status, ~]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','diamond',['diamond' binEnd]) '" blastp --query "' fastaFile{1} '" --out "' outFile '_r' num2str(i) '" --db "' tmpDB '" --more-sensitive --outfmt 6 qseqid sseqid evalue pident length bitscore ppos --threads ' cores]);
0111     delete([tmpDB '*']);
0112     if status~=0
0113         EM=['DIAMOND blastp did not run successfully, error: ', num2str(status)];
0114         dispEM(EM,true);
0115     end
0116 end
0117 
0118 %Done with the DIAMOND blastp, do the parsing of the text files
0119 for i=1:numel(refFastaFiles)*2
0120     tempStruct=[];
0121     if i<=numel(refFastaFiles)
0122         tempStruct.fromId=modelIDs{i};
0123         tempStruct.toId=organismID{1};
0124         A=readtable([outFile '_' num2str(i)],'Delimiter','\t','Format','%s%s%f%f%f%f%f');
0125     else
0126         tempStruct.fromId=organismID{1};
0127         tempStruct.toId=modelIDs{i-numel(refFastaFiles)};
0128         A=readtable([outFile '_r' num2str(i-numel(refFastaFiles))],'Delimiter','\t','Format','%s%s%f%f%f%f%f');
0129     end
0130     tempStruct.fromGenes=A{:,1};
0131     tempStruct.toGenes=A{:,2};
0132     tempStruct.evalue=table2array(A(:,3));
0133     tempStruct.identity=table2array(A(:,4));
0134     tempStruct.aligLen=table2array(A(:,5));
0135     tempStruct.bitscore=table2array(A(:,6));
0136     tempStruct.ppos=table2array(A(:,7));
0137     blastStructure=[blastStructure tempStruct];
0138 end
0139 
0140 %Remove the old tempfiles
0141 delete([outFile '*']);
0142 end
